Parent.Question: Do you want to keep track of your activity in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Logging helps you keep track of what's happening in your Azure environment.

Parent.Question: What is your Azure account number?
Parent.Explanation: We need your Azure account number to set up logging.

Parent.Question: How long do you want to keep track of your activity in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: You can choose how long you want to keep track of your activity in Azure.

Parent.Question: Do you want to know if your monitoring tools are working properly?
Parent.Explanation: Keeping track of the health of your monitoring agents helps you know if they're working properly.

Parent.Question: Do you want to keep track of changes made in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Change tracking helps you keep track of what changes have been made in your Azure environment.

Parent.Question: Do you want to keep your monitoring tools up to date?
Parent.Explanation: Keeping your monitoring tools up to date helps ensure that they're working properly.

Parent.Question: Do you want a detailed history of your activity in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: The activity log provides a detailed history of what's happening in your Azure environment.

Parent.Question: Do you want to see how your virtual machines are performing?
Parent.Explanation: VM insights help you understand how your virtual machines are performing.

Parent.Question: Do you want to see how different parts of your Azure environment are connected?
Parent.Explanation: Service map shows you the relationships between different parts of your Azure environment.

Parent.Question: Do you want to check the security of your databases?
Parent.Explanation: SQL assessments help you check the security of your databases.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your databases from advanced threats?
Parent.Explanation: SQL advanced threat protection helps you protect your databases from advanced threats.

Parent.Question: Do you want to check the vulnerabilities of your databases?
Parent.Explanation: SQL vulnerability assessments help you identify vulnerabilities in your databases.

Parent.Question: Do you want to secure your Azure environment with Microsoft Defender?
Parent.Explanation: Microsoft Defender helps secure your Azure environment.

Parent.Question: Who should we contact if there is a security issue?
Parent.Explanation: We need a contact email address in case there is a security issue.

Parent.Question: Do you want to secure your servers in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting your servers helps ensure their security in Azure.

Parent.Question: Do you want to secure your containers in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting your containers helps ensure their security in Azure.

Parent.Question: Do you want to secure your web applications in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting your app services helps ensure the security of your web applications in Azure.

Parent.Question: Do you want to secure your open-source databases in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting your open-source relational databases helps ensure their security in Azure.

Parent.Question: Do you want to secure your data storage in Azure?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting your storage solutions helps ensure the security of your data in Azure.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your Cosmo DB database?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting Cosmos DB appliances with Microsoft Defender helps to detect and prevent security threats by using real-time monitoring and analysis of the Cosmos DB runtime and configuration.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your SQL database?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting SQL appliances with Microsoft Defender helps to detect and prevent security threats by using real-time monitoring and analysis of the SQL runtime and configuration.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your SQL database on a virtual machine?
Parent.Explanation: Protecting SQL on VM appliances with Microsoft Defender helps to detect and prevent security threats by using real-time monitoring and analysis of the SQL runtime and configuration.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your secret storage?
Parent.Explanation: Enabling security measures for your Azure Key Vaults will protect the sensitive information stored in them, such as keys and secrets, from unauthorized access or unauthorized use.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your domain name system?
Parent.Explanation: Enabling security measures for your Azure DNS servers will protect your domain name resolution infrastructure from malicious attacks and unauthorized changes.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your Azure resources?
Parent.Explanation: Enabling security measures for your Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates and deployments will help to ensure that your resources are deployed securely and in compliance with your security policies.

Parent.Question: Do you want to use Microsoft Sentinel for better security?
Parent.Explanation: Enabling central log analysis, correlation, and threat detection with Microsoft Sentinel will provide improved security visibility by analyzing, combining and correlating log events across your Azure environment, making it easier to detect and respond to security threats.

Parent.Question: Do you want to limit access to your subnets?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to limit access to your subnets to only those with network security groups.

Parent.Question: Do you want to restrict remote access to your desktops?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to restrict remote access to your desktops through Remote Desktop Protocol.

Parent.Question: Do you want to avoid using a public IP address?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to avoid using a public IP address for security reasons.

Parent.Question: Do you want to backup your virtual machines?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to create backups of your virtual machines.

Parent.Explanation: Enter your Subscription ID used for identity.

Parent.Explanation: Enter your identity address subnet.

Parent.Explanation: Enter your Subscription ID used for online LZ.

Parent.Explanation: Enter your Subscription ID used for Corp Connected.

Parent.Question: Enter your Subscription ID for Corp LZ
Parent.Explanation: Enter your Subscription ID used for Corp LZ.

Parent.Question: Do you want to restrict IP forwarding?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to restrict IP forwarding for security reasons.

Parent.Question: Do you want to avoid exposing your endpoints over a public IP?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to avoid exposing your endpoints over a public IP for security reasons.

Parent.Question: Do you want to encrypt your data in transit?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to encrypt your data as it is being transmitted.

Parent.Question: Do you want to monitor your virtual machines?
Parent.Explanation: Choose if you want to monitor your virtual machines for performance and security reasons.

Parent.Question: Do you want to keep track of your Virtual Machines?
Parent.Explanation: This will let you see how your VMs are doing and if they are running smoothly.

Parent.Question: Do you want to set rules for your AKS (Kubernetes)?
Parent.Explanation: This will help you control how your AKS is used and by whom.

Parent.Question: Do you want to stop people from accessing your AKS with too much power?
Parent.Explanation: This will make your AKS more secure and prevent unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to prevent too much power for AKS?
Parent.Explanation: This will ensure your AKS is only accessible by those who need it.

Parent.Question: Do you want to block public IPs for Databricks?
Parent.Explanation: This will help secure your Databricks from unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to block virtual networks for Databricks?
Parent.Explanation: This will help secure your Databricks and prevent unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to stop people from using Databricks in certain ways?
Parent.Explanation: This will help control how Databricks is used and by whom.

Parent.Question: Do you want to block HTTP access for AKS?
Parent.Explanation: This will help secure your AKS and prevent unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to save copies of your VMs?
Parent.Explanation: This will let you restore your VMs in case of problems.

Parent.Question: Do you want to block Remote Desktop access?
Parent.Explanation: This will prevent unauthorized access to your VMs through Remote Desktop.

Parent.Question: Do you want to stop subnets without a security group?
Parent.Explanation: This will help secure your subnets from unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to keep a record of what's happening in your databases?
Parent.Explanation: This will let you see what's happening in your databases and if there are any problems.

Parent.Question: Do you want to encrypt your SQL databases to protect against threats?
Parent.Explanation: This will secure your SQL databases and prevent unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to make sure your storage is secure?
Parent.Explanation: This will ensure your data is protected when stored.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your Landing Zone from attacks?
Parent.Explanation: This will help prevent unauthorized access and attacks.

Parent.Question: Do you want to have private DNS for your Landing Zone?
Parent.Explanation: This will help secure your Landing Zone and prevent unauthorized access.

Parent.Question: Do you want to use Azure DevOps?
Parent.Explanation: This will let you use Azure DevOps for your projects.

Parent.Explanation: This is needed to connect to your GitHub account.

Parent.Question: What is your secret key for GitHub?
Parent.Explanation: This is needed to connect to your GitHub account.

Parent.Question: What is the name of your GitHub repository?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking for the name of the repository you have on GitHub where your code is stored.

Parent.Explanation: This is asking if you want to set up your network with a hub and spoke structure for organization.

Parent.Question: Do you want to protect your network from big attacks?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking if you want to protect your network from high volume malicious attacks.

Parent.Question: Do you want a VPN Gateway set up?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking if you want to set up a VPN Gateway for secure connections.

Parent.Question: Provide your subnet mask for the VPN Gateway
Parent.Explanation: This is asking for the subnet mask for the VPN Gateway, which is a pattern used to identify network addresses.

Parent.Question: What is the type of your VPN Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking for the type (Standard or Premium) of the VPN Gateway that you want, with redundancy across availability zones.

Parent.Question: Do you want a zone redundant or regional VPN Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking if you want a VPN Gateway that is either spread across availability zones for redundancy or available in a specific region.

Parent.Question: What is the type of your regional VPN Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking for the type (Standard or Premium) of the VPN Gateway that you want, available in a specific region.

Parent.Question: Do you want to use an ExpressRoute Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking if you want to use an ExpressRoute Gateway, which is a type of connection to Azure.

Parent.Question: What is the type of your ExpressRoute Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking for the type (Standard or Premium) of the ExpressRoute Gateway that you want, with redundancy across availability zones.

Parent.Question: Do you want a zone redundant or regional ExpressRoute Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking if you want an ExpressRoute Gateway that is either spread across availability zones for redundancy or available in a specific region.

Parent.Question: What is the type of your regional ExpressRoute Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: This is asking for the type (Standard or Premium) of the ExpressRoute Gateway that you want, available in a specific region.

Parent.Question: Do you want an ExpressRoute gateway?
Parent.Explanation: Express Route provides a fast, private connection to Azure from your data center, office, or colocation facility.

Parent.Question: Which type of Express Route Gateway do you want?
Parent.Explanation: Choose the security level for your redundant ExpressRoute gateway.

Parent.Question: Do you want a regional or redundant ExpressRoute gateway?
Parent.Explanation: A zone redundant gateway provides high availability in the event of a failure in a single Azure zone, while a regional gateway provides resiliency in the event of a complete regional outage.

Parent.Question: What is your SKU for regional ExpressRoute Gateway?
Parent.Explanation: ExpressRoute Gateway comes in different options, select one that suits your needs.

Parent.Question: Do you want to add extra security to your network with Azure Firewall?
Parent.Explanation: Azure Firewall is a cloud-based network security solution that helps protect your network from malicious attacks.

Parent.Question: Which level of protection do you want for Azure Firewall?
Parent.Explanation: Azure Firewall comes in different levels, or Tiers, to provide varying levels of protection.

Parent.Question: Can you specify the settings for how Azure Firewall should protect your network?
Parent.Explanation: The Subnet Mask defines the settings for how Azure Firewall will secure your network.

Parent.Question: Where do you want Azure Firewall to be located?
Parent.Explanation: Azure Firewall can be deployed in different Availability Zones for optimal performance and reliability.

Parent.Question: Do you want Azure Firewall to also protect your domain name system (DNS)?
Parent.Explanation: Enabling Azure Firewall as a DNS Proxy helps protect your network from malicious DNS requests.

Parent.Question: What is the naming convention prefix for your resources? (max 10 characters, should be unique at tenant-scope)
Parent.Explanation:
The Management Group Names/IDs created via the ALZ Portal Accelerator deployment are all based on the Resource Prefix (Root ID) that you enter.  Analogous to a file/folder hierarchy structure, the Resource Prefix (Root ID) will be the name of the root of the deployment.  Here is an example:
	• <Resource Prefix (Root ID)> - Intermediate Root Management Group - e. g.  Contoso
		○ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-platform
			§ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-management
			§ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-connectivity
			§ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-identity
		○ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-landingzones
			§ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-online
			§ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-corp
		○ <Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-decommissioned
<Resource Prefix (Root ID)>-sandbox

Parent.Question: Insert your single subscription ID
Parent.Explanation:
A key consideration for resource organization design is to simplify management across the environment for increased workload numbers and scale.  Dedicated subscriptions are recommended for the different platform resource categories to ensure scale, sustainability, and segregation of duties.  A single subscription can be used for proof of concepts, or by smaller organizations. 

It is recommended separate platform subscriptions for management (monitoring), connectivity, and identity when they're required. 

Establish a dedicated management subscription in your platform management group to support global management capabilities like Azure Monitor Log Analytics workspaces and Azure Automation runbooks. 
Establish a dedicated identity subscription in your platform management group to host Windows Server Active Directory domain controllers when needed. 
Establish a dedicated connectivity subscription in your platform management group to host an Azure Virtual WAN hub, private Domain Name System (DNS), ExpressRoute circuit, and other networking resources.  A dedicated subscription ensures that all your foundation network resources are billed together and isolated from other workloads. 
Use subscriptions as a democratized unit of management aligned with your business needs and priorities.
